briefTitle: Feasibility and Identification of Breast Cancer Patients for Potential Avoidance of Surgery
officialTitle: Pilot Study for Identification of Breast Cancer Patients for Potential Avoidance of Surgery: Accuracy of Image Guided Percutaneous Sampling Compared with Surgery to Evaluate Eradication of Breast Cancer After Preoperative Chemotherapy
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Diagnostic Accuracy of Ultrasound-Guided FNA and Core Biopsy of Initial Breast Cancer Region Compared to Standard Surgery with Pathologic Evaluation
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. \>/= 18 years old
2. Histologic diagnosis of triple negative or HER2 amplified breast cancer, clinical stage T1-4, N0-3, M0/1 receiving preoperative systemic therapy and planned surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

1) N/A
